Description: Limestone tomb relief depicting Menankhpepy: Menankhpepy is shown on the left, standing and holding the staff and sceptre and dressed in full official uniform, including the leopard skin. He has also the 'good name' Mnỉ. On the right, in one horizontal and three vertical lines, is a simple ḥtp-dỉ-nsw text containing Meni's titles. The whole is carved in a high relief of powerful but rather ungainly style. Some of the signs have been damaged. No colour is preserved.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: B. Porter & R. Moss, 'Topographical Bibliography of Ancient Egyptian Hieroglyphic Texts, Reliefs and Paintings' V (Oxford: Clarendon Press), p. 110.
Bibliographic references: James 1961 / Hieroglyphic texts from Egyptian stelae, etc. Part 1 (pl.37)
Condition: Fair; some of the signs have been damaged.
